title: Cat. 81.3  Noa Noa (Fragrant), 1894/95
publication_title: Gauguin Paintings, Sculpture, and Graphic Works at the Art Institute of Chicago
content:
<section class="osci-tk-epub-section tombstone" id="tombstone">Noa noa (Fragrant)  
1894/95  
Second state of three  
Wood-block print in black ink, over brush and solvent thinned and selectively applied yellow ocher ink, on cream wove paper; 151 × 119 mm (image/sheet)  
The Art Institute of Chicago, gift of Edward McCormick Blair, 2002.260  
Guérin 47, Kornfeld 34 II/III  
For the verso, see fig. 81.3.1

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section provenance" id="provenance">Marcel Guérin (1873–1948), Paris.

Sold by Hill-Stone, New York, to Edward McCormick Blair (1915–2010), Chicago, May 1986.

Given by Edward McCormick Blair to the Art Institute of Chicago, 2002.

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section exhibitions" id="exhibitions">Bar Harbor, Maine, Ethel H. Blum Gallery, College of the Atlantic, From Paradise to Eden: Gauguin in Tahiti, Aug. 10–Sept. 11, 1999, cat. 26.

Art Institute of Chicago, Intimate Encounters: Paul Gauguin and the South Pacific; The Edward McCormick Blair Collection, Sept. 6, 2003–Jan. 11, 2004, cat. 24.

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section references" id="references">Douglas Druick and Peter Zegers, From Paradise to Eden: Gauguin in Tahiti, exh. cat. (College of the Atlantic, Ethel H. Blum Gallery, 1999), p. 10, cat. 26.

Art Institute of Chicago, Intimate Encounters: Paul Gauguin and the South Pacific; The Edward McCormick Blair Collection, exhibition brochure (Art Institute of Chicago, 2003), cat. 24.

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section other_documentation" id="other_documentation">Signed in wood block, lower right, printed in white-line manner: P / G / O [sideways]

</section><section epub:type="footnotes" id="footnotes">According to Alan Stone of Hill-Stone, New York, this print was purchased from two Dutch booksellers at the New York Antiquarian Book Fair in April 1986. The booksellers indicated they purchased the library of Marcel Guérin and found the print immured in a book (along with another Gauguin woodcut). Stone purchased the print and sold it to Blair the following month.

According to Alan Stone of Hill-Stone, New York, this print was purchased from two Dutch booksellers at the New York Antiquarian Book Fair in April 1986. The booksellers indicated they purchased the library of Marcel Guérin and found the print in a book (along with another Gauguin woodcut). Stone purchased the print and sold it to Blair the following month. See also Alice Adam Ltd. inventory of Edward McCormick Blair’s collection, curatorial object file, Department of Prints and Drawings, Art Institute of Chicago.

</section><section id="figures">Cat. 81.3 Noa noa (Fragrant), 1894/95.

fig. 81.3.1 Verso of Gauguin’s Noa Noa (Fragrant) (1894/95). The Art Institute of Chicago, 2002.260.

</section>
